title: Police Misconduct Records and Internal Affairs Investigations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Phoenix Police Department
Public Information Officer
Phoenix Police Headquarters
620 W Washington St
Phoenix, AZ 85003

To Whom It May Concern:

Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request - Detailed Police Misconduct Records, Internal Affairs Investigations, and Litigation Cases

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, A.R.S. §§ 39-121 to 39-122 and 39-128, I hereby request the following records:

Reports of alleged excessive force by Phoenix Police Department officers from the past five years (2018 to 2023).
Reports of alleged abuse of authority within the Phoenix Police Department from the past five years.
Reports of alleged unlawful arrest or search by Phoenix Police Department officers from the past five years.
Reports of alleged discrimination by Phoenix Police Department officers from the past five years.
Reports of alleged sexual assault by Phoenix Police Department officers from the past five years.
Reports of alleged dishonesty within the Phoenix Police Department from the past five years.
Completed internal affairs investigations related to the aforementioned misconduct reports.
Any and all findings or documents produced by internal affairs related to the misconduct reports and investigations.
Records of any litigation cases involving the Phoenix Police Department related to the aforementioned categories of misconduct, including case numbers, parties involved, and final judgments or settlements.

I want to highlight a few court cases that underscore the importance of public access to such information. The U.S. Supreme Court stated in NLRB v. Robbins Tire Co., 437 U.S. 214 (1978), that the core purpose of the FOIA is to contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government. Furthermore, in Carlson v. Pima County, 141 Ariz. 487 (1984), the Arizona Supreme Court reiterated the significance of the state's public records law for public accountability.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Training Courses and Records Related to Compliance and Racial Bias Awareness Training

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Phoenix Police Department
Public Information Officer
Phoenix Police Headquarters
620 W Washington St
Phoenix, AZ 85003

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request

Dear Public Information Officer,

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking specific information and records related to training courses offered to officers by the Phoenix Police Department. I kindly request your assistance in providing the following information within the timeframe of this request:

Training Courses:
a. A comprehensive list of all training courses offered to officers covering compliance and racial bias awareness within the period from 2021 to 2023.
b. Detailed course descriptions and syllabi for each training course, including topics covered and learning objectives.
c. Information regarding the providers or organizations responsible for conducting these training courses.

Completion Records:
a. Records of officer participation and completion of each training course, including dates of completion.
b. Documentation verifying the successful completion of each training course, such as certificates or completion reports.
c. Any evaluations, feedback, or assessments collected from officers regarding the training courses.

Course Provider Information:
a. Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with external training providers or organizations.
b. Records of any payments made to training providers for the courses offered.
c. Any communications or correspondence between the Phoenix Police Department and the training providers.

To ensure a comprehensive search, please include all relevant departments, units, and training divisions within the Phoenix Police Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Training Courses on Compliance and Racial Bias Awareness - Provo Police Department

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

Provo Police Department
Public Information Officer
48 N 300 W
Provo, UT 84601

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request

Dear Public Information Officer,

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking specific information and records related to training courses offered to officers by the Provo Police Department. I kindly request your assistance in providing the following information and documents for the period from 2021 to 2023:

Training Courses:
a. A comprehensive list of all training courses offered to officers covering compliance and racial bias awareness within the specified timeframe.
b. Detailed course descriptions and syllabi for each training course, including topics covered and learning objectives.
c. Information regarding the providers or organizations responsible for conducting these training courses.
Completion Records:
a. Records of officer participation and completion of each training course, including dates of completion.
b. Documentation verifying the successful completion of each training course, such as certificates or completion reports.
c. Any evaluations, feedback, or assessments collected from officers regarding the training courses.
Course Provider Information:
a. Agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with external training providers or organizations.
b. Records of any payments made to training providers for the courses offered.
c. Any communications or correspondence between the Provo Police Department and the training providers.
To ensure a comprehensive search, please include all relevant departments, units, and training divisions within the Provo Police Department

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: McLennan County Administrator Justin Chapman  DA's Office Records Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

04/08/2022
Subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County DA's office Sherre Johnston

Email
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records from the March 12th. arrest of Sherre Whitney Johnston at the home of Truman Simons, including narrative, and all officers films and dash cams, body cams etc. Also, records and video cam recordings plus body cam recordings from the P.D and ambulance on her now, completted, TWO DWI's. These three cases are all closed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
